name: Ají Dulce Pepper
description: Ají dulce (or sweet chili) peppers are a specific Venezuelan variety of Capsicum chinense peppers that are related to the habanero but have a much milder, smoky flavor. Their 5cm long fruits start green and turn red as they ripen. The plants are small and compact well-suited to container gardening.
sowing_method: Direct seed indoors, transplant seedlings outside after hardening off.
